Don't be turned off by graphics, this game has aged (mostly) very well. The story telling is done amazingly well, making it feel like most of things happening would happen even if you weren't there. Every weapon has a purpose and the right time to use it, while the shooting mechanics are basic, the part that makes them fun is making a strategy before going into a battle, you really have to think about what you're doing. Xen is garbage, it's boring and just acts as a way to add an hour or two onto the game. Overall though, I would still highly recommend this game in 2020, it's shocking how well the game aged for being from 1997.

Bueno, no hay demasiado qué decir, es una obra de arte que cumple y supera las expectativas. Tanto la acción como la historia están bien diseñadas, y los gráficos están bien hechos. Pueden lucir anticuados para muchos, pero no tiene que ser ultrarrealista para ser bueno, pues permite la inmersión en el juego sin ningún problema, a diferencia de muchos "ultrarrealistas" de los que solo destacan sus sombras y reflejos + antialiasing.
huver silahini alip gelyom kral

This game is just a few years older than I am, and it is honestly one of my favourite games of all time. I first tried it in high school, and found the experience frustrating, but recently I've been playing all the Half-Life games, and while I do enjoy the puzzles and physics in Half-Life 2 and its episodes, there's just something about this game that has me coming back every time. Even after playing the remake Black Mesa, I still think Half-Life 1 is one of the most unique experiences I've ever had with a video game. The only complaint I have about this game are the final chapters in the Xen dimension, but it seems everyone else has the same feeling, and anyway the rest of the game makes up for that flaw tremendously. If you have the time and the money, I would recommend getting this game because while it is over 2 decades old, a lot of the elements that were revolutionary in its time are still very enjoyable now.

Half Life eski olmasının yanında hala günümüzde oynanabilite taşıyor. Eski olduğundan oyunda alt yazı yok, ne kadar gerek duyarsınız bilmem ama steamde altyazı da indirilebiliyor. Her ne kadar subtitle modla çalıştığında saat göstermese de ben oyunu bitirdim. İlk altı saat altyazısız oynadım ve hikaye yönünde, direktifleri almakta epey zorlanmıştım. Ama sonra bir şans daha verdim ve oyun eski grafiklerine rağmen beni headcrab gibi yaratıklarıyla ve atmosferiyle içine çekti ve oyuncu olarak gerim gerim gerildim. Elbette eski olduğundan bazı mekanikler, bölüm tasarımları size sıkıcı gelebilir, gelecektir de. Yine de bir şans verip hl evrenine girebilirseniz bu efsanenin neden efsane olduğunu anlamak hiç de zor değil. Bir levye ile dünyaları fetheden adam is hired.

Well, let's see, we have a good one here folks. Half Life was valve's debut title, but this is no rushed, poorly made, mess of a game, no, not at all. Half Life is one of the most revolutionary and fun shooters that I have played in a good while, and while it's graphics are dated, I still recommend it over Black Mesa because of the map layouts feeling better with more comfortable enemy AI. This game is so good in fact, that a twitch series parodying this game blew up and now my profile pic is from that series. While that series uses Half Life: Source, I do not recommend that version since HL: Source was clearly rushed with many bugs and glitches. Overall, it takes a while to get used to this game, but when you do, it feels like an adrenaline rush of an adventure. Now before I go, I do want to mention the combat in this game. The combat in Half Life feels great, but not everybody will like it. The combat in Half Life uses strategy- wait, wait stop, stop walking away.
When I say strategic, I mean that the combat has you revisiting encounters to see what works and what doesn't, and while it sounds boring, it's what makes the game shine. The combat in Half Life is better than any other fps I've played with it's over powered, but low ammo weapons like the "Tas Cannon" and "Gluon Gun", to the more simple weapons, like a machine gun that also fires grenades, or an alien that you shove your hand into, which makes you able to shoot smaller aliens that are like little homing missiles. This game is crazy, and while people poop on the ending area, Xen, I got past it pretty quick, and while it was boring at times in Xen, the rest of the game was one of the best fps games I have ever played.
I absolutely recommend this game, and it's only $10, but wait for the summer sale, so you can get the half life complete bundle for about $17 or less. Half Life Complete includes: (Half Life, Half Life: Source, Half Life: Blue Shift, Half Life: Opposing Force, Half Life Deathmatch, HL: Deathmatch Source, Half Life 2, HL2: Episode 1&2, etc.)

Half-Life is a gem of the videogaming history that puts you in the shoes of Gordon Freeman, a physicist who, following an accident during an experiment in the Black Mesa Research Facility, must survive an alien invasion and stop it.

I'm not going to lie, I never played an Half-Life game before. However, I constantly heard about how great the series was and decided to give it a shot. What do I have to say? The game still holds up in 2020 (it came out in 1998) and has got a beautiful story.

The puzzles aren't easy and they do require some thinking before doing anything. Nothing in the game's world is put randomly, and even the small detail can make the difference. The same thing applies for the fights, thank to its complex AIs. You have to pay attention to your enemies and the game will not hesitate to punish you if you stay in a safe spot for too long.

I'd easily give this game a 8/10. The graphics, for the time it was created, were good and, generally speaking, is still able to excite and entertain even today. Great job, Valve!

pros
- mods work and are easy to install
- the game has an understandable story without any cut-scenes
- good arsenal with no over board concepts
- the length of the game is long but not to long 
cons
- some chapters take up a good chunk of play time and these chapters are made poorly
- some fights are repetitive and just an exchange of damage until one dies
- H.E.C.U guys are made well put like the fights there attack cycle is repetitive and they always just yeet grenades intruding your spot of cover and forcing you to run away before you are damaged leaving you vulnerable

despite these flaws this game is fun to play always filled with hidden secrets and worth the price
